SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

com.rhizospherejs.gwt.client
Annotation Type RhizosphereModelAttribute

@Target(value=METHOD)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface RhizosphereModelAttribute

Method annotation to expose POJO getters as attributes of Rhizosphere models.

When POJOs are used to define Rhizosphere models (by implementing the RhizosphereModel interface), each field that needs to be exported to the generated Rhizosphere model should have its getter annotated with this annotation.

Methods can be annotated with this annotation if they satisfy these requirements: public, not static, must not accept any argument, must have a non-void return type. Examples: 


   public String getName();        // valid
   public int amount();            // valid
   public int[] getColor();        // valid (although no equivalent 
                                   //   Rhizosphere types exists, see below).
   public static double size();    // NOT valid, static
   protected String getAddress();  // NOT valid, non public
   public void nothing();          // NOT valid, void return type
   public String getAddress(String zipCode);  // NOT valid, accepts arguments.

Any method annotated with this annotation maps to an exported attribute on the generated Rhizosphere model with the following characteristics:

  • The attribute name, i.e. the assigned javascript variable name, is derived from the method name (removing get or is prefixes if present), unless an explicit name is defined via name() or descriptor(). Examples: A getColor() method will result in a color attribute, isHappy() will result in happy and preferredIceCream() will result in preferredIceCream.
  • The attribute user-visible label is similarly derived from the method name, unless an explicit label is defined via label() or descriptor(). Examples: A getColor() method will result in a Color label.
  • The attribute type is derived from the method return type. If the method return type matches one of the supported Rhizosphere types (string, number, dates, etc...) the equivalent Rhizosphere type will be used, otherwise the attribute will be exported to an opaque object (not accessible from the native Rhizosphere JS library code). Refer to the exposed setters in JsoBuilder for the list of supported Rhizosphere types.

Unless explicitly forbidden via the opaque() option, annotated attributes will also exported to the visualization metamodel. Therefore the attribute will be included also in Rhizosphere UI controls, such as dynamic filters and layout selectors.

All the above aspects can be customized by declaring an explicit descriptor() bound to each exported attribute.

Consider the following example: 


 public class Person implements RhizosphereModel {

   private String name;
   private String address;
   private Date dateOfBirth;
   private int heightInCm;
   private double weightInKg;

   public Person(String name,
                 String address,
                 Date dateOfBirth,
                 int heightInCm,
                 double weightInKg) {
     this.name = name;
     this.address = address;
     this.dateOfBirth = dateOfBirth;
     this.heightInCm = heightInCm;
     this.weightInKg = weightInKg;
   }

   @RhizosphereModelAttribute
   public String getName() {
     return name;
   }

   @RhizosphereModelAttribute(name="height", label="Height (cm)")
   public int getHeightInCm() {
     return heightInCm;
   }

   @RhizosphereModelAttribute(name="weight", label="Weight (kg)")
   public double getWeightInKg() {
     return weightInKg;
   }

   @RhizosphereModelAttribute(descriptor=DOBDescriptor.class)
   public Date getDateOfBirth() {
     return dateOfBirth;
   }

   @RhizosphereModelAttribute(opaque=true)
   public String address() {
     return address;
   }
 }

It will result in the following Rhizosphere model and metamodel attributes:

  • A 'name' attribute of type string.
  • An 'height' and 'weight' numeric attributes with custom labels.
  • A 'dateOfBirth' attribute with a custom descriptor
  • An 'address' attribute of type string that will not be exposed to the metamodel.

Because of the opaque setting, dynamic filters will be generated for the 'name', 'height', 'weight' and 'dateOfBirth' attributes, but not for the 'address' one. The same applies to the configuration of layout options.

Author:
battlehorse@google.com (Riccardo Govoni)

Optional Element Summary
 java.lang.Class<? extends AttributeDescriptor> descriptor
          Defines a descriptor class for this attribute.
 java.lang.String label
          Define the user-visible label of the exported attribute.
 boolean modelId
          Specifies that this method uniquely identifies the generated model among all the others in the same visualization.
 java.lang.String name
          Define the name (that is, the assigned Javascript variable name) of the exported Rhizosphere attribute.
 boolean opaque
          Defines whether this attribute should be opaque with respect to metamodel generation.
 

name

public abstract java.lang.String name
Define the name (that is, the assigned Javascript variable name) of the exported Rhizosphere attribute. If omitted, will be automatically generated from the name of the annotated method.

Default:
""

label

public abstract java.lang.String label
Define the user-visible label of the exported attribute. If omitted, will be automatically generated from the name of the annotated method.

Default:
""

descriptor

public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends AttributeDescriptor> descriptor
Defines a descriptor class for this attribute. Descriptors offer an higher degree of customization in defining the characteristics of the exported attribute, in particular for the generation of the associated metamodel entry (which drives several aspects of the Rhizosphere UI such as dynamic filters and layouts).

Default:
com.rhizospherejs.gwt.client.meta.AttributeDescriptor.EmptyDescriptor.class

opaque

public abstract boolean opaque
Defines whether this attribute should be opaque with respect to metamodel generation. An opaque attribute will not be present in the visualization UI controls such as dynamic filters and layout controls.

Default:
false

modelId

public abstract boolean modelId
Specifies that this method uniquely identifies the generated model among all the others in the same visualization. Each Rhizosphere model must be identifiable by an ID that must be unique among all the models part of the same visualization. If undefined, Rhizosphere will provide an autogenerated id. Autogenerated ids are not guaranteed to be stable across separate visualization deployments, so explicit ids should be defined whenever a Rhizosphere model must remain uniquely addressable over time.

Default:
false
